def.threejs.three

Class Material

  • java.lang.Object
    • def.js.Object
      • def.threejs.three.EventDispatcher
        • def.threejs.three.Material
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LineBasicMaterial, LineDashedMaterial, MeshBasicMaterial, MeshDepthMaterial, MeshLambertMaterial, MeshNormalMaterial, MeshPhongMaterial, MeshStandardMaterial, MultiMaterial, PointsMaterial, ShaderMaterial, SpriteMaterial

    public class Material
extends EventDispatcher
    Materials describe the appearance of objects. They are defined in a (mostly) renderer-independent way, so you don't have to rewrite materials if you decide to use a different renderer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class def.threejs.three.EventDispatcher

        EventDispatcher.EventData

    • Field Detail

      • alphaTest

        public double alphaTest
        Sets the alpha value to be used when running an alpha test. Default is 0.

      • blendDst

        public BlendingDstFactor blendDst
        Blending destination. It's one of the blending mode constants defined in Three.js. Default is OneMinusSrcAlphaFactor.

      • blendDstAlpha

        public double blendDstAlpha
        The tranparency of the .blendDst. Default is null.

      • blendEquation

        public BlendingEquation blendEquation
        Blending equation to use when applying blending. It's one of the constants defined in Three.js. Default is AddEquation.

      • blendEquationAlpha

        public double blendEquationAlpha
        The tranparency of the .blendEquation. Default is null.

      • blending

        public Blending blending
        Which blending to use when displaying objects with this material. Default is NormalBlending.

      • blendSrc

        public jsweet.util.union.Union<BlendingSrcFactor,BlendingDstFactor> blendSrc
        Blending source. It's one of the blending mode constants defined in Three.js. Default is SrcAlphaFactor.

      • blendSrcAlpha

        public double blendSrcAlpha
        The tranparency of the .blendSrc. Default is null.

      • clipIntersection

        public Boolean clipIntersection
        Changes the behavior of clipping planes so that only their intersection is clipped, rather than their union. Default is false.

      • clippingPlanes

        public Object clippingPlanes
        User-defined clipping planes specified as THREE.Plane objects in world space. These planes apply to the objects this material is attached to. Points in space whose signed distance to the plane is negative are clipped (not rendered). See the WebGL / clipping /intersection example. Default is null.

      • clipShadows

        public Boolean clipShadows
        Defines whether to clip shadows according to the clipping planes specified on this material. Default is false.

      • colorWrite

        public Boolean colorWrite
        Whether to render the material's color. This can be used in conjunction with a mesh's .renderOrder property to create invisible objects that occlude other objects. Default is true.

      • depthFunc

        public DepthModes depthFunc
        Which depth function to use. Default is LessEqualDepth. See the depth mode constants for all possible values.

      • depthTest

        public Boolean depthTest
        Whether to have depth test enabled when rendering this material. Default is true.

      • depthWrite

        public Boolean depthWrite
        Whether rendering this material has any effect on the depth buffer. Default is true. When drawing 2D overlays it can be useful to disable the depth writing in order to layer several things together without creating z-index artifacts.

      • fog

        public Boolean fog
        Whether the material is affected by fog. Default is true.

      • id

        public double id
        Unique number of this material instance.

      • isMaterial

        public Boolean isMaterial
        Used to check whether this or derived classes are materials. Default is true. You should not change this, as it used internally for optimisation.

      • lights

        public Boolean lights
        Whether the material is affected by lights. Default is true.

      • name

        public String name
        Material name. Default is an empty string.

      • needsUpdate

        public Boolean needsUpdate
        Specifies that the material needs to be updated, WebGL wise. Set it to true if you made changes that need to be reflected in WebGL. This property is automatically set to true when instancing a new material.

      • opacity

        public double opacity
        Opacity. Default is 1.

      • overdraw

        public double overdraw
        Enables/disables overdraw. If greater than zero, polygons are drawn slightly bigger in order to fix antialiasing gaps when using the CanvasRenderer. Default is 0.

      • polygonOffset

        public Boolean polygonOffset
        Whether to use polygon offset. Default is false. This corresponds to the POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL WebGL feature.

      • polygonOffsetFactor

        public double polygonOffsetFactor
        Sets the polygon offset factor. Default is 0.

      • polygonOffsetUnits

        public double polygonOffsetUnits
        Sets the polygon offset units. Default is 0.

      • precision

        public Object precision
        Override the renderer's default precision for this material. Can be "highp", "mediump" or "lowp". Defaults is null.

      • premultipliedAlpha

        public Boolean premultipliedAlpha
        Whether to premultiply the alpha (transparency) value. See WebGL / Materials / Transparency for an example of the difference. Default is false.

      • dithering

        public Boolean dithering
        Whether to apply dithering to the color to remove the appearance of banding. Default is false.

      • flatShading

        public Boolean flatShading
        Define whether the material is rendered with flat shading. Default is false.

      • side

        public Side side
        Defines which of the face sides will be rendered - front, back or both. Default is THREE.FrontSide. Other options are THREE.BackSide and THREE.DoubleSide.

      • transparent

        public Boolean transparent
        Defines whether this material is transparent. This has an effect on rendering as transparent objects need special treatment and are rendered after non-transparent objects. When set to true, the extent to which the material is transparent is controlled by setting it's .opacity property. Default is false.

      • type

        public String type
        Value is the string 'Material'. This shouldn't be changed, and can be used to find all objects of this type in a scene.

      • uuid

        public String uuid
        UUID of this material instance. This gets automatically assigned, so this shouldn't be edited.

      • vertexColors

        public Colors vertexColors
        Defines whether vertex coloring is used. Default is THREE.NoColors. Other options are THREE.VertexColors and THREE.FaceColors.

      • visible

        public Boolean visible
        Defines whether this material is visible. Default is true.

      • userData

        public Object userData
        An object that can be used to store custom data about the Material. It should not hold references to functions as these will not be cloned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Material

        public Material()

    • Method Detail

      • Clone

        @Name(value="clone")
public Material Clone()
        Return a new material with the same parameters as this material.

      • copy

        public Material copy(Material material)
        Copy the parameters from the passed material into this material.
        Parameters:
        material -

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This disposes the material. Textures of a material don't get disposed. These needs to be disposed by Texture.

      • setValues

        public void setValues(MaterialParameters values)
        Sets the properties based on the values.
        Parameters:
        values - A container with parameters.

      • toJSON

        public Object toJSON(Object meta)
        Convert the material to three.js JSON format.
        Parameters:
        meta - Object containing metadata such as textures or images for the material.

      • update

        public void update()
        Call .dispatchEvent ( { type: 'update' }) on the material.

      • toJSON

        public Object toJSON()
        Convert the material to three.js JSON format.
        Parameters:
        meta - Object containing metadata such as textures or images for the material.
